posts.post_content:
I am starting to pursue this collection a little more now. Like quite a few others here, I like the T206 cards, but don't necessarily want to tackle "The Monster". So I am going after this "mini-monster", an Indianapolis master team set. Collecting the Carolina Brights, Broad Leaf 350, and Drum 350 backs will be extremely difficult, if not next to impossible so I might not try for those, but you never know.

I am wanting cards in the Poor - Good range. Mostly looking for raw, but wouldn't pass up graded cards (from SGC, PSA, or BVG only) either.

Below is the list of cards, sorted by player with their confirmed backs. The backs are then sorted by rarity (easiest to most difficult ... according to T206Resource.com). Cards I own have been crossed out.

Please email or PM the cards you have along with offer.


Burke, Jimmy
  *  [STRIKE]Piedmont 350[/STRIKE]
  *  Sweet Caporal 350 Fact. 30
  *  Sweet Caporal 350 Fact. 25
  *  [STRIKE]Sovereign 350 (Forest Green)[/STRIKE]
  *  Polar Bear
  *  [STRIKE]Old Mill[/STRIKE]
  *  Cycle 350
  *  [STRIKE]American Beauty 350 (with frame)[/STRIKE]
  *  El Principe De Gales (EPDG)
  *  Carolina Brights
  *  Broad Leaf 350
  *  Drum 350

I have not bought any t206's yet but being from Indiana I thought about starting with the Indy team as well. The only thing i dislikeis I havent seen any that are colorful or cool backgrounds. mainly just plain color red or green. Alot of portraits too instead of action shots but still cool since its Indiana based.

Good luck and I cant wait to see what you put together!

Monthly Bump --- Still looking for these.


Thanks.
